greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows of number of ways k domicules can be placed on an n X n square (n >= 0, 0 <= k <= floor(n^2/2)).
comment: A domicule is either a domino or it is formed by the union of two neighboring unit squares connected via their corners. In a tiling the connections of two domicules are allowed to cross each other.
The n-th row gives the coefficients of the matching-generating polynomial of the n X n king graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jun 20 2017
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..13, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, King Graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Matching-Generating Polynomial
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local d, f, k;
else for k to d while not l[k] do od;
`if`(n>1 and l[k+d], x*b(n, subsop(k=f, k+d=f, l)), 0)+
`if`(k<d and l[k+1], x*b(n, subsop(k=f, k+1=f, l)), 0))
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = Module[{d, f, k}, d = Length[l]/2; f = False; Which[ n == 0, 1, l[[1 ;; d]] == Table[f, d], b[n-1, Join[l[[d+1 ;; 2d]], Table[ True, d]]], True, For[k = 1, !l[[k]], k++]; Expand[b[n, ReplacePart[l, k -> f]] + If[k<d && n>1 && l[[k+d+1]], x*b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k + d + 1 -> f}]], 0] + If[k>1 && n>1 && l[[k + d - 1]], x*b[n, ReplacePart[ l, {k -> f, k + d - 1 -> f}]], 0] + If[n>1 && l[[k + d]], x*b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+d -> f}]], 0] + If[k<d && l[[k+1]], x*b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+1 -> f}]], 0]]]];
T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 7}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 09 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A242861 (the same for dominoes), A239264.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 04 2014
